pingball.physics

Class Gadget

  • java.lang.Object
    • pingball.physics.Gadget
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Absorber, CircleBumper, Flipper, OuterWalls, SquareBumper, TriangularBumper

    public abstract class Gadget
extends java.lang.Object
    A Gadget represents anything that can be placed on a Pingball board. Every Gadget has a coefficient of reflection, a trigger, and an action. A 'trigger' represent events that happen to a Gadget instance, while an 'action' represents an event that the Gadget will perform as a response to it's 'trigger'. The coefficient of reflection is a scalar multiplier that is applied to the magnitude of a ball's velocity after it bounces off of a Gadget.
    Author:
    Erik, Shelby, Natasha

        name - the name of the gadget
        x - the x coordinate of the upper left corner of this gadget, 0 <= x < 20
        y - the y coordinate of the upper left corner of this gadget 0 <= y < 20;

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public final boolean connect(Gadget obj)
        Connects the trigger of this object to the parameter object such that triggering this object triggers the parameter object as well.
        Parameters:
        obj - the Gadget that needs to be connected to this
        Returns:
        true if this object successfully connected it's trigger to obj's

      • disconnect

        public final boolean disconnect(Gadget obj)
        Disconnects the parameter object from this object such that when this object is triggered, obj is no longer triggered. If obj is not connected to
        Parameters:
        obj - the Gadget that needs to be disconnected from this
        Returns:
        true if the connection between this objects trigger and obj has been broken, false if there was never said connection to begin with.

      • startAction

        public abstract void startAction()
        Sets up and begins the action sequence associated with this Gadget - i.e. rotating a flipper. If no action is associated with this, then it has no effect. Gadgets that have an associated action sequence are also added to the board's active list.

      • action

        public abstract void action(double dt)
        Performs the action associated with this Gadget for the specified amount of time - i.e. rotating a flipper for .02 sec. If no action is associated with this, then it has no effect.
        Parameters:
        dt - the time to perform this action

      • handleCollision

        abstract void handleCollision(Ball ball)
        Reflects the ball off of the surface of the gadget it hits and notifies this gadget that it has been hit
        Parameters:
        ball - the ball that hit this gadget

      • calculateCollisionTimeWithBall

        abstract double calculateCollisionTimeWithBall(Ball ball)
        Calculates the amount of time until the ball hits this gadget.
        Parameters:
        ball - the ball that may hit this gadget
        Returns:
        the minimum positive time until the ball hits this gadget

      • putInDisplay

        public abstract void putInDisplay(char[][] board,
                int hOffset,
                int vOffset)
        Puts the gadget into the provided board in text format. The given board may have buffers on the outer edges such that the true origin of the board maybe offset towards the inside
        Parameters:
        board - the board to have text put in
        hOffset - the horizontal offset of the board's origin
        vOffset - the vertical offset of the board's origin

      • stateDescription

        public abstract java.lang.String stateDescription()
        Returns a String that describes the state of the Gadget including the Gadget's name, type, and location. Other critical properties is present such as orientation, connected Gadgets, etc.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the state of this Gadget

        Parameters:

        Handles bouncing a ball off of one of the sides
        Parameters:
        side - the side to bounce the ball off of
        ball - the ball that needs to be reflected

      • getReflectionCoeff

        public double getReflectionCoeff()
        Returns the coefficient of reflection of this Gadget

        Values of 1.0 represents perfectly elastic collisions. Values less than 1.0 represents a damping coefficient for the ball which decreases the ball's speed and kinetic energy. Values greater than 1.0 represent increases in speed and kinetic energy.

        Returns:
        the coefficient of reflection for this bumper

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns the width of this Gadget in units of L
        Returns:
        the width of this

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns the height of this Gadget in units of L
        Returns:
        the height of this

      • trigger

        public void trigger(Ball ball)
        Trigger this Gadget and all other Gadget objects connected to this instance. This effectively begins whatever action sequences are associated with triggering a Gadget. All Gadget objects can be triggered by a ball.
        Parameters:
        ball - the ball that hit and triggered this Gadget

      • checkRep

        protected boolean checkRep()
        All gadgets must follow this rep invariant. All gadgets must have their bounding box contained in the 20L by 20L board.
        Returns:
        true if the gadget follows this rep invariant.
